de.tudarmstadt.ukp.clarin.webanno.brat.controller

Class SpanAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tudarmstadt.ukp.clarin.webanno.brat.controller.SpanAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TypeAdapter

    public class SpanAdapter
extends Object
implements TypeAdapter
    A class that is used to create Brat Span to CAS and vice-versa
    Author:
    Seid Muhie Yimam, Richard Eckart de Castilho

    • Method Detail

      • setLockToTokenOffsets

        public void setLockToTokenOffsets(boolean aSingleTokenBehavior)
        Span can only be made on a single token (not multiple tokens), e.g. for POS or Lemma annotations. If this is set and a span is made across multiple tokens, then one annotation of the specified type will be created for each token. If this is not set, a single annotation covering all tokens is created.
        Parameters:
        aSingleTokenBehavior - whether to enable the behavior.

      • isLockToTokenOffsets

        public boolean isLockToTokenOffsets()
        Returns:
        whether the behavior is enabled.
        See Also:
        setLockToTokenOffsets(boolean)

        Add annotations from the CAS, which is controlled by the window size, to the brat response GetDocumentResponse

        Parameters:
        aJcas - The JCAS object containing annotations
        aResponse - A brat response containing annotations in brat protocol

        aColoringStrategy - the coloring strategy to render this layer
        aFeatures - the features.

        public Integer add(org.apache.uima.jcas.JCas aJcas,
                   int aBegin,
                   int aEnd,
                   AnnotationFeature aFeature,
                   String aValue)
            throws BratAnnotationException
        Add new span annotation into the CAS and return the the id of the span annotation
        Parameters:
        aJcas - the JCas.
        aBegin - the begin offset.
        aEnd - the end offset.
        aFeature - the feature.
        aValue - the value of the annotation for the span
        Returns:
        the ID.
        Throws:
        BratAnnotationException - if the annotation cannot be created/updated.

      • automate

        public void automate(org.apache.uima.jcas.JCas aJcas,
                     AnnotationFeature aFeature,
                     List<String> aLabelValues)
              throws BratAnnotationException,
                     IOException
        Description copied from interface: TypeAdapter
        Add new annotation to the CAS using the MIRA prediction. This is different from the add methods in the TypeAdapters in such a way that the begin and end offsets are always exact so that no need to re-compute
        Specified by:
        automate in interface TypeAdapter
        Parameters:
        aJcas - the JCas.
        aFeature - the feature.
        aLabelValues - the values.
        Throws:
        BratAnnotationException - if the annotations could not be created/updated.
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • getAttachTypeName

        public String getAttachTypeName()
        A field that takes the name of the annotation to attach to, e.g. "de.tudarmstadt...type.Token" (Token.class.getName())
        Specified by:
        getAttachTypeName in interface TypeAdapter
        Returns:
        the attach type name.
